body:
That's not that simple. There are several cases:

\1. Manipulate string in model/controller/helper. That's unavoidable.
\2. Controller method for view display, ex :

drop_breadcrumb "Home"
drop_breadcrumb "Post List"
drop_breadcrumb "Post Title"

will render Home >> Post List >> Post Title

If we use breadcrumb in View, it will be massy and ULTRA slow. ( write Ruby LOGIC in View is ULTRA slow )

\ 3. Single language application. Rails's I18n is not that perfect. Usually we don't use I18n in only one-language application. Because if we do, the application will suddenly be massy and unmaintainable. Nobody would want to use I18n since day-one when specs says that is NOT an international application.
